channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Apple's 512GB Mac Mini M1 drops back down to $800 at Amazon
item.description: Save $100 on Apple's Mac Mini M1 with 512GB of storage at Amazon.

item.title: London will open electric scooter trials in June
item.description: London will begin shareable e-scooter trials next month operated by micromobility providers Lime, Dott and TIER.

item.title: McLaren reveals the $225k Artura, its first production hybrid supercar
item.description: McLaren has been in the business of making ludicrously light and fast supercars for years but it wasn’t until 2021 that the company put one of its High-Performance Hybrid (HPH) designs into full production. Say hello to the $225,000 Artura.

item.title: Wacoal's AI-powered myBraFit app scans your body to give you sizing advice
item.description: Wacoal debuts myBraFit, an AI-powered bra-sizing app.

item.title: Lamborghini plans to launch its first fully electric car before 2030
item.description: Lamborghini stands out from other supercar makers for a lack of EVs or hybrids, but the Italian automaker has finally unveiled its electrification plans.

item.title: The Morning After: Apple Music adds lossless streaming to its entire catalog
item.description: Today’s headlines: AT&T's WarnerMedia is merging with Discovery, Apple Music adds Dolby Atmos and lossless streaming starting next month, Samsung teases its next generation of flexible displays.

item.title: Fitbit's Sense smartwatch falls to a new low of $240 at Amazon
item.description: This is your chance to grab Fitbit's Sense smartwatch for $90 less than its original price: It's now available for $240 on Amazon.

item.title: Professional tuner says Apple TV's auto-calibrator doesn't deliver
item.description: YouTube channel HDTVTest suggests Apple TV's calibration feature doesn't provide its intended results on popular television sets.

item.title: Beats' true wireless 'Studio Buds' surface without AirPods stems
item.description: Beats might be set to release a new pair of wireless earbuds that look considerably different from other Apple earphone products, judging by a leak.

item.title: Intel's next-gen hybrid Optane SSDs are coming to laptops soon
item.description: Optane memory H20 is a new storage product from intel that combines its high-performance Optane memory with a regular QLC SSD in capacities of 512GB and 1TB.

item.title: New iPad Pro shipments continue to slip as Apple faces display production issues
item.description: According to Bloomberg, Apple is dealing with supply chain issues that could leave buyers waiting weeks for their new 12.9-inch iPad Pro.

item.title: Amazon is reportedly negotiating to buy MGM
item.description: Amazon is reportedly considering a $9 billion acquisition that would make it the owner of franchises like James Bond, Stargate and Robocop.

item.title: Logitech's $1,200 Scribe whiteboard camera can hide presenters
item.description: Scribe's AI-enhanced software allows the camera to render presenters transparent so that people watching the presentation can have an easier time seeing the whiteboard.

item.title: Roku jailbreak gives users control over what channels they install
item.description: Now you can get root access on Roku devices and install your own software.

item.title: Fox, 'Rick & Morty' creator plan a blockchain and NFT-enabled animated series
item.description: Dan Harmon's new animated series for Fox, 'Krapopolis' is the first one to be 'curated entirely on the blockchain.'

item.title: California DMV has Tesla 'under review' over Musk's FSD claims
item.description: The California Department of Motor Vehicles appears to be actively investigating Tesla over CEO Elon Musk's audacious claims about his company's Full Self-Driving technology.

item.title: Amazon's plan to reduce warehouse injuries includes guided meditation
item.description: Amazon introduces a wellness program to help reduce the risk of injury at its warehouses.

item.title: Facebook wants ‘other companies’ to use the Oversight Board, too
item.description: Facebook executives have suggested the Oversight Board could one day work with "other companies," but competing platforms have little incentive to do so.

item.title: Paramount+ adds Brazil's top soccer league to its live sports stable
item.description: Every Brasileirão match will stream on the platform through 2023.

item.title: Oculus will soon let you see how silly you look while playing VR games
item.description: You'll also be able to keep an eye on your phone notifications without taking off your headset.

item.title: Canoo's first consumer 'lifestyle vehicle' will cost almost $35,000
item.description: Canoo's futuristic EV has a price starting at $34,750, and you can reserve one starting today.

item.title: The 2021 Jeep Wrangler Sahara 4xe is a PHEV for trail hounds
item.description: The state of technology has advanced by leaps and bounds since the dark day of the mid-80s and, thankfully, a whole bunch of it has found its way into Jeep’s first PHEV, the trail-blazing Wrangler Limited Sahara 4xe.

item.title: Epic Games sues AR glasses maker Nreal over its name
item.description: It infringes on trademarks for Unreal, according to Epic.

item.title: Nintendo shows off 'Mario Golf: Super Rush' speed golf and battle royale modes
item.description: The Golf Adventure RPG mode includes skill challenges and boss battles.

item.title: Microsoft Teams is ready for 'friends and family'
item.description: Microsoft Teams is well-known as a competitor to Slack for workplace communications, but almost a year ago the company announced it was also getting some features geared at using it with family or friends. After a long preview period, Microsoft is announcing that Teams is now available to anyone and free for personal use.
